js_hotkey is an extension to the nJord platform that allows script to implement custom global hotkeys that will call back a JavaScript function. For example, you could register a hotkey will spawn a registry editor when a user types Ctrl-Alt-R. Currently, the extension allows registering the control, alt, and shift buttons along with printable, non white-space, ascii characters as hotkey registrations. The extension exposes the following functions to the nJord platform:

|| *Name* || *Description* ||
|| [RegisterHotKey] || Registers a hotkey with windows. ||
|| [UnregisterHotKey] || Unregisters a hotkey from windows. ||
|| [StopHotKeys] || Unregisters all hotkeys from windows. ||
